hero.title: Sharp Thinking, Practical Execution
hero.lede: With Martlet, Martijn brings sharp, critical technical thinking and execution. Not just to write reports, but to solve problems for real - together with the team on the shop floor.
hero.sublede: The Netherlands must keep making. That takes companies that keep improving - in product, process and automation.
why.p1: Martlet exists because the Netherlands must keep making. Our manufacturing base runs on 35,000+ SMEs that deliver unique products worldwide. They have craftsmanship, but often struggle to innovate. Daily firefighting beats development.
why.p2: Martijn brings exactly what is missing: sharp, critical technical thinking that accelerates innovation and protects long-term competitiveness.
why.callout.title: Lack of focus is often the real problem.
why.callout.body: Not everything can be done at once. Martijn helps to choose what delivers most now - and guides the change.
how.lede: We do not start with assumptions, but with clarity.
how.li1: Is this really a problem? What do we see, what do we measure, what does it cost?
how.li2: Why is this a problem? Cause over symptom. Processes, technology and context.
how.li3: What is the smallest intervention with the biggest effect? Focus over scope.
how.li4: Technology alone is rarely enough. Change often fails on people, ownership and rhythm.
how.li5: Collaboration is required. Without buy-in there is no lasting improvement. Martlet works with the existing team, not alongside it.
how.p2: Martlet combines analysis with delivery. If something "works on paper" but not on the floor, it is not done.
what.p1: Martlet helps SME manufacturers solve product, process and automation challenges structurally. We bring extra technical thinking, focus and execution where capacity or expertise is missing.
what.s1.p: Structured value analysis and hard product choices. Improve product/market fit and remove waste from the design.
what.s1.meta1: For whom: Companies that want better performance from the product that carries their business.
what.s2.p: Problem analysis, plan design, review of existing plans and implementation support until it works.
what.s2.meta1: For whom: Companies that want automation but want to prevent misfit and failed implementation.
what.s3.p: Temporary reinforcement as project lead, engineering lead or innovation manager. Unblock stuck projects and deliver.
what.s3.meta1: For whom: Companies that temporarily need extra thinking and execution power to move forward.
fit.li1: You know something is rubbing, but not what the real bottleneck is.
fit.li2: There are too many initiatives and too little focus.
fit.li3: An automation or improvement project is stuck (or about to get stuck).
fit.li4: You temporarily lack technical leadership capacity.
fit.li5: You want results on the floor, not only plans in PowerPoint.
steps.li4: Deliver & embed - implement, train, improve, hand over ownership
values.li1: Ownership: we do not stop at advice
values.li4: Pragmatic: big effect comes from small steps
cta.h: Want to bring sharpness and focus to the table?
cta.p: Schedule a short call. Then we test together: is this really a problem, why, and what is the shortest route to results.
footer: Martlet - Thinking and doing for SME manufacturing.
